titles.title: Community Partnerships Against Crime Act
COMPAC
Community Partnerships Against Crime Act of 1993
A bill to establish community-based partnerships to fight crime in public and assisted housing.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S9559-9560)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

term.name: Department of Housing and Urban Development
Federal aid to law enforcement agencies

bill.summary: 7/27/1993--Introduced. Community Partnerships Against Crime Act, or COMPAC - Amends the Public and Assisted Housing Drug Elimination Act of 1990 to expand the use of anti-drug crime public housing grants to all types of crime. Makes long-term (one-year initial, five-year total) grants available to public housing authorities with especially severe crime problems. Makes other applicants eligible for two-year grants, with preference for subsequent funding.
